DataElement.preferredName: Normal Tissue Excision Collection Date and Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date or date and time normal tissue from a non-diseased patient was surgically removed from an organ.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Normal Tissue Excision Collection Date Time
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins._The date or date and time of the specimen or data collection.

An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.:The date or date and time of the specimen or data collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date or date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
